</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	DETERx Pipeline
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have applied our DETERx platform technology to Xtampza as well as other product candidates in our pipeline. We recently completed formulation development work for our extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release, abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent hydrocodone program. Based upon an assessment of the market opportunity and the potential to differentiate from currently marketed hydrocodone products as well as programs in development, we are prioritizing our abuse deterrent hydrocodone program as our second product in development. We filed an IND with the FDA in December 2015 and initia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a clinical trial in the first quarter of 2016. We also have an extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release, abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent oxymorphone program for the treatment of chronic pain for which we have filed an investigational new drug application, or IND. This program has been granted Fast Track status by the FDA. In addition, we have other extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release, abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent product candidates that have completed preliminary preclinical studies, including morphine for pain and methylphenidate for the treatment of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, or ADHD. All of these product candidates share similar abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent qualities as Xtampza and are designed to be suitable for patients with difficulty swallowing. We own all of the rights to our product candidates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/18/0001558370-16-004252_COLL20151231X10K003.GIF" STYLE="WIDTH: 5.690972IN; HEIGHT: 2.314583IN" ALT="PICTURE 30">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Each of our product candidates is being developed to seek FDA approval in accordance with Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, or FD&amp;C Act. Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) permits an applicant to file an NDA that relies, in part, on data not developed by or for the applicant and to which the applicant has not received a right of reference, such as the FDA&#x2019;s findings of safety and efficacy in the approval of a similar drug, or listed drug, or published literature in support of its application.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Xtampza
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our lead product candidate, Xtampza, is an abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent, extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release, oral formulation of oxycodone tentatively approved by the FDA for the management of pain severe enough to require daily, around
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;clock, long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term opioid treatment and for which alternative treatment options are inadequate. The active ingredient in Xtampza is oxycodone, which is approved by the FDA and other regulators around the world in a number of both immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release and extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release drug products. We developed Xtampza using our proprietary, DETERx abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent technology to address common methods of abuse, including chewing, crushing and/or dissolving, and then taking it orally or snorting or injecting Xtampza. On November&nbsp;6, 2015, the FDA granted tentative approval to the NDA for Xtampza for the management of pain severe enough to require daily, around
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;clock, long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term opioid treatment and for which alternative treatment options are inadequate. The FDA granted tentative approval because Xtampza met the required quality, safety and efficacy standards for approval but
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	subject
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, at that time,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to an automatic stay of up to 30&nbsp;months as a result of patent litigation filed by Purdue in March 2015. The FDA may grant final regulatory approval upon the earliest to occur of expiration of the automatic stay, the court invalidating Purdue&#x2019;s patents or issuing an opinion of non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;infringement,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	expiration of Purdue&#x2019;s listed patents.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In February 2016, the District Court of Massachusetts entered a judgment in our favor related to Purdue&#x2019;s three Orange Book-listed patents that were the cause of the 30 month stay.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We submitted our request for final approval of the Xtampza NDA on February 26, 2016. The FDA has set a PDUFA goal date of April 26, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We sought approval of Xtampza through the FDA&#x2019;s Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) regulatory approval pathway using OxyContin OP as our listed drug, with the goal of obtaining abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent claims in our product label based on three categories of our completed abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrence studies. In July 2014, we completed our pivotal Phase&nbsp;3 efficacy and safety clinical trial for Xtampza in patients with moderate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;severe chronic low back pain, which met efficacy and safety endpoints. We also completed Category&nbsp;1, Category&nbsp;2 and Category&nbsp;3 abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent studies and clinical trials designed to follow the January 2013 FDA draft guidance on abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent opioids, and which we believe to be consistent with the April 2015 final FDA guidance, as well as direct guidance received from the FDA in numerous meetings and written communications, including a pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;NDA meeting in April 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We also conducted an alternative dosing clinical trial to assess the feasibility of administering Xtampza by sprinkling the microspheres onto applesauce. This clinical trial demonstrated that Xtampza microspheres retain their abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent and extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release properties even after being removed from the capsule and mixed with soft food. If Xtampza ultimately receives final regulatory approval, Xtampza could be the only abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release oxycodone
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	product with product labeling features targeting patients with CPD. As part of the FDA&#x2019;s tentative approval of our NDA for Xtampza, we have a tentatively approved product label. The key product label characteristics are summarized below:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 7.2PT;TEXT-INDENT: -7.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	Dosage and Administration
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT;">

	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;O
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pen capsule and sprinkle microspheres on soft foods or directly into a cup, and then directly into the mouth.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

</P>

	Pharmacology
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Pharmacokinetic data demonstrating that chewed and crushed Xtampza ER is bioequivalent to intact dosing.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Black Box Warning and Precautions
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	No warnings or precautions relating to:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Crushing, chewing or dissolving the drug can cause rapid release and absorption of a potentially fatal dose.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Difficulty swallowing, risks of IV injection, etc.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Drug Abuse
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;deterrent claims
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;1 in vitro
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;2 pharmacokinetic
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:32.92%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.32%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:64.76%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;3 human abuse potential
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Market Opportunity
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe that Xtampza, if it ultimately receives final regulatory approval, can capture a significant share of the $6&nbsp;billion U.S. extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioid market, including a portion of the existing $2.5&nbsp;billion OxyContin OP market. In addition, we believe that Xtampza can become a market leader for treating patients with chronic pain who have difficulty swallowing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	OxyContin OP Extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;Release Market
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Until recently, no product that uses oxycodone as its active ingredient had been approved with product label claims describing the abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent characteristics of its product. Purdue launched OxyContin OP in 2010. In April 2013, the FDA determined that Purdue had been successful in demonstrating OxyContin OP&#x2019;s abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent characteristics and permitted Purdue to amend its product label to include certain abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent claims. Since the launch of OxyContin OP, there has been a reduction in the overall abuse of OxyContin, primarily in the snorted and injected routes of administration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The FDA also concluded that the benefits of the previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;approved non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent OxyContin no longer outweighed its risks and removed it from the list of drugs eligible to serve as a reference product for future generic or Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) approvals. As a result, we expect that all extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release oxycodone products, including generic products, will now be required to have abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent claims as part of the FDA approval process. We believe this change in FDA policy creates a significant opportunity for Xtampza, if ultimately approved, to capture a portion of the extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release oxycodone market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Despite OxyContin OP&#x2019;s commercial success, it carries with it a well
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;documented abuse stigma both for physicians who prescribe it and for patients who use it to treat chronic pain. In a market research study conducted for us in 2013, 35% of patients surveyed who were taking OxyContin OP indicated concern that their friends or family have a negative perception of OxyContin OP. Of the 1,021 patients surveyed in the study, 11% of chronic pain patients responded that they have had their opioid medication stolen, most often from their home, and 76% indicated an interest in switching to a pain medication similar to OxyContin OP but that was more abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent. A market research study of 30 physicians conducted for us in 2015 concluded that while physicians view OxyContin OP as an effective and valuable option, one third reported prescribing it less often than they would like because of patients&#x2019; reticence to use OxyContin OP because of its reputation for addiction and abuse.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Further, in a third party study of post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;marketing data on misuse and diversion of prescription opioid analgesics, the initial decline in abuse of OxyContin OP by patients who reported abusing the non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent OxyContin 30&nbsp;days prior to entering treatment for opioid abuse disorder, plateaued at 25% to 30%, with no further decreases from 2012 to study conclusion in 2014. A sub
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;population of participants was surveyed to investigate their continued abuse of OxyContin. Among the 88 participants who abused both non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent OxyContin and OxyContin OP, their continued abuse of OxyContin OP was explained by: (i)&nbsp;a transition from non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;oral routes of administration to oral use (approximately 43%); (ii)&nbsp;successful efforts to defeat the abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent formulation mechanism leading to a continuation of inhaled or injected use (approximately 34%); and (iii)&nbsp;exclusive use of the oral route independent of formulation type (approximately 23%). Representative comments of participants who continued to abuse OxyContin OP demonstrated that participants were able to identify methods of circumventing the abuse deterrent properties using the internet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Other Extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;Release Opioids
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	While OxyContin OP is the largest selling extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioid in the United States by dollars in 2014, there are approximately 23&nbsp;million additional prescriptions for non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioids annually in the United States. Many of these opioids include active ingredients, such as morphine, that are commonly perceived as having greater adverse side effects than oxycodone
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based formulations. Because of the abuse stigma associated with OxyContin OP and non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent opioid formulations, we believe that Xtampza
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	offer physicians treating chronic pain an attractive alternative to the existing options. Our market research also demonstrates that payors recognize the prevalence of opioid abuse and its corresponding economic burden. This research indicates that &#x201C;brand&#x201D; prices would be acceptable for products that are differentiated. As such, we aim to achieve broad Tier&nbsp;3 payor coverage on commercial plans and contract with Medicare and Medicaid. In a market research study conducted for us, 83% of disease specialists (such as oncologists and neurologists) and 67% of pain specialists surveyed indicated that, if approved, they would prescribe Xtampza for patients without dysphagia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Chronic Pain with Dysphagia
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In a market research survey conducted for us, of 1,021 patients with chronic pain, 30% of the patients reported that they have trouble swallowing or do not like to swallow pills, and 65% of the patients did not realize that cutting, crushing or grinding extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioids can change the drug release profile. None of the currently approved abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent opioid drugs has an FDA product label that permits the sprinkling of the product on food
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	into a cup, and then
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	directly in the mouth and administration through feeding tubes for use by patients with CPD, creating an unmet medical need due to the lack of adequate treatment options. Further, in an effort to make them easier to swallow, some patients with CPD&nbsp;&#x2014; and 47 of the 1,021 patients participating in the survey conducted for us&nbsp;&#x2014; crush their prescribed extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioids and can inadvertently harm themselves because of the rapid immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release of the active ingredient. Because our Xtampza microspheres are designed to be able to be removed from the capsule and still retain their abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent and extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release properties, we believe that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Xtampza may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	be an effective pain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;management solution for patients with CPD. An external marketing study performed for us in 2013 estimated that Xtampza, if it ultimately receives final regulatory approval, has a peak revenue potential for U.S. patients with CPD in excess of $700&nbsp;million annually.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Clinical Development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have completed numerous studies and clinical trials on Xtampza. We submitted an NDA for Xtampza to the FDA on December&nbsp;12, 2014. On September&nbsp;11, 2015, the Anesthetic and Analgesic Drug Products Advisory Committee and Drug Safety and Risk Management Advisory Committee of the FDA
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, or the FDA Joint Advisory Committee,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	voted unanimously (23
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;0) to support the regulatory approval of Xtampza. Xtampza received tentative FDA approval on November&nbsp;6, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We submitted our request for final approval of the Xtampza NDA on February 26, 2016. The FDA has set a PDUFA goal date of April 26, 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We sought approval of Xtampza through the FDA&#x2019;s Section&nbsp;505(b)(2) regulatory approval pathway using OxyContin OP as our listed drug with the goal of obtaining abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent claims in our product label based on all three categories of our completed abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrence studies. To date, we have completed bioequivalence and bioavailability studies, a pivotal Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial of Xtampza in patients with moderate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;severe chronic low back pain, which met safety and efficacy endpoints, as well as Category&nbsp;1, Category&nbsp;2 and Category&nbsp;3 abuse deterrence studies and clinical trials based on the January 2013 FDA draft guidance regarding abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent opioids.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Phase&nbsp;3 Clinical Trial
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	After discussions with the FDA, we conducted a single pivotal Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial designed to show safety and efficacy of Xtampza in a chronic pain population. The Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial was a multi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;center, prospective, double
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;blind, enriched enrollment, randomized withdrawal, placebo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;controlled clinical trial that examined the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of Xtampza versus placebo in opioid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;experienced and opioid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;na&#xEF;ve patients with moderate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;severe chronic low back pain. This study was designed with acetaminophen as the rescue medication in order to avoid the potential issue of immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioid rescue medication use confounding the effect of the study drug. The trial design is depicted in the figure below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/18/0001558370-16-004252_COLL20151231X10K004.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.415972IN; HEIGHT: 3.040278IN" ALT="GRAPHIC">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Of the 740 patients enrolled in the initial open
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;label titration portion of the clinical trial, 389 patients met the criteria for randomization, which included stable and effective pain scores, ability to tolerate the drug at the dose at which effective pain relief was achieved and compliance with all other aspects of the clinical trial protocol. These 389 patients were randomized into a 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;week, double
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;blind maintenance phase in which they were either maintained on their current dose regimen of Xtampza or were tapered to a placebo. The primary efficacy endpoint of the clinical trial was the change in average pain intensity from baseline to week 12; pain was measured using an 11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;point pain intensity numerical rating scale. Sensitivity analyses were performed to evaluate the primary endpoint. Secondary endpoints in the clinical trial included evaluation of safety and tolerability, quality of life, physical disability, and global impression of change. The graph below shows the daily average pain score in the randomized, intent to treat, or ITT, population.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/18/0001558370-16-004252_COLL20151231X10K005.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.092361IN; HEIGHT: 4.791667IN" ALT="GRAPHIC">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The clinical trial demonstrated that the estimated marginal mean change in average pain score from Randomization Baseline to Week 12 was greater for the placebo treatment group (1.85) than for the Xtampza treatment group (0.29). The clinical trial successfully met the primary efficacy endpoint by showing that the difference between treatment groups in the estimated marginal mean change in average pain score was statistically significant (p&lt;0.0001). All sensitivity analyses showed statistically significant results (with p values ranging from 0.0002 to &lt;0.0001) supporting the primary endpoint analysis favoring Xtampza compared to placebo. All secondary endpoints were achieved. The p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;value, or probability value, is a measure of statistical significance reflecting the likelihood that an observed result occurred by chance. Generally, p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;values less than or equal to 0.05 are considered to indicate statistical significance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Xtampza was well
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;tolerated in this study. No new safety concerns were identified. The most common adverse events, or AEs, (&gt;5%) reported by patients in the Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial during the titration phase were nausea, headache, constipation, drowsiness, itching, vomiting and dizziness. Each of these AEs declined in frequency with continued treatment. The most common adverse reactions (&gt;5%) reported by patients in the Phase&nbsp;3 clinical trial comparing Xtampza with placebo are shown in the table below. One subject was hospitalized for a serious adverse event moderate in severity of gastroesophageal reflux and subsequently discharged upon resolution of the event. The investigator at the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	clinical trial site assessed this event as possibly related to study drug, but no action was taken with the study drug due to this event.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:06.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

	6.4
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Phase&nbsp;1 Clinical Trials
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We performed two Phase&nbsp;1 bioequivalence and bioavailability clinical trials to compare the blood levels obtained after administration of Xtampza versus OxyContin OP. The first, in which we enrolled 48 patients, compared the pharmacokinetics, or PK, of Xtampza with OxyContin OP in fasted and fed states following single dose administration, with results shown in the figure below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/18/0001558370-16-004252_COLL20151231X10K006.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.740278IN; HEIGHT: 2.602083IN" ALT="GRAPHIC">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The single
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose PK profiles for Xtampza and OxyContin OP were similar. However, in the fasted state, the total amount of absorption, known as area under the curve, or AUC, was lower when compared with the fed state for Xtampza, suggesting a larger food effect than OxyContin OP. As a result, our tentatively approved product label indicates that Xtampza should be taken with food and should be taken with approximately the same amount of food with every dose to ensure that consistent plasma levels are achieved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We performed a second phase&nbsp;1 clinical trial to assess the safety and PK of Xtampza and OxyContin OP in fed and fasted states following multiple
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;dose administration. In this clinical trial, which enrolled 45&nbsp;patients, as shown in the figure below, both products were taken with food twice per day for five days, and the PK profiles&nbsp;&#x2014; which were assessed based on two variables, peak plasma level of the drug, or C
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	max
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and AUC&nbsp;&#x2014; were bioequivalent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>

	&nbsp;
</P>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.14%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:68.50%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 7.2PT;TEXT-INDENT: -7.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	OxyContin OP
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Evaluation of Abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;Deterrence of Xtampza
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Xtampza was developed and evaluated in a manner consistent with recommendations described in the January 2013 draft FDA guidance on the evaluation and product labeling of abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent opioids. We believe our development program is consistent with the April 2015 final FDA guidance. Listed below is an overview of the studies and clinical trials needed for FDA abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent product labeling.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent formulation on measures that predict how probable it is the formulation will be attractive to abusers (&#x201C;liked&#x201D;)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.06%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:32.80%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;3: The results from the oral and intranasal clinical abuse potential studies indicate that the medication has properties expected to deter abuse via oral, intranasal and intravenous routes.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:17.66%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4&nbsp;&#x2014; Post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;market
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.08%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:21.20%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;marketing Epidemiologic Studies
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.06%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:22.12%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Conduct epidemiologic studies capable of detecting a change in the occurrence of abuse and abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;related outcomes
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.06%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:32.80%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 18PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;">
	&#xF0B7;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;4: There was a demonstrated reduction in abuse of this medication in the community setting compared to the levels of abuse, overdose and death that occurred when only formulations of the same opioid without abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent properties were available.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our development program consisted of in vitro studies and clinical trials, the results of which indicate that Xtampza may result in reduced abuse by manipulation followed by oral ingestion, snorting or attempted intravenous injection. The table below summarizes the abuse deterrence studies and clinical trials we conducted for Xtampza.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

	18

</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:11.22%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:107.08%;TEXT-INDENT: -10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.08%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:107.08%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:24.00%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:107.08%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.08%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:107.08%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:60.62%;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:107.08%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Oral Chewed PK and HAP Clinical Trial (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	CP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;OXYDET
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;1: In Vitro Studies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We demonstrated abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent properties of Xtampza in each mode of physical, chemical and route specific manipulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Physical Manipulations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	One of the key objectives of our Category&nbsp;1 studies was to determine the most effective tool to crush Xtampza microspheres and OxyContin OP tablets as part of a particle size reduction, or PSR, study. The results of this PSR study informed the design of our PK clinical trials. A range of household tools was selected based upon the review of the literature and researching the internet for common methods used by abusers. Based upon this, 10 tools were selected that cut, broke, ground and crushed the Xtampza microspheres and/or OxyContin OP tablets. For OxyContin OP, five of these tools were effective in laboratory tests at substantially increasing the rate of drug release, resulting in &#x201C;dose dumping&#x201D; of the active ingredient. For Xtampza, none of these tools was effective at causing dose dumping. A subset of these tools were also applied to the Xtampza microspheres after pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;treatment by freezing or heating, but were still unable to cause dose dumping. Consistent with FDA guidance, results of the physical manipulation study were replicated by an independent third party analytical laboratory registered with the FDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Chemical Extraction
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our chemical extraction studies were completed using the optimal method of crushing for Xtampza and OxyContin OP as identified in the above Category&nbsp;1 study. We conducted a series of laboratory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based Category&nbsp;1 chemical manipulation studies to investigate simple and complex extraction methods and dissolution of Xtampza and OxyContin OP in a variety of commonly used beverages, solvents, and soft foods. Results from these studies show that Xtampza microspheres resist extraction of the oxycodone active ingredient into a usable non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;toxic form that could be abused. By contrast, after crushing, the active ingredient was readily extracted from OxyContin OP. Results from these studies show that Xtampza has a greater resistance to a wide variety of solvents used for extraction than OxyContin OP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Route Specific&nbsp;&#x2014; Injection
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To assess the ability for abusers to inject Xtampza, the microspheres were crushed, suspended in water and the resulting suspension was attempted to be expelled with needles and syringes. Only negligible amounts of the microspheres were able to pass through any size needle, including an 18 gauge needle (which was the largest needle size tested). By contrast, crushing OxyContin OP and mixing it in water resulted in a gel where a substantial amount, up to 54% of the active ingredient, could be passed through an 18 gauge needle, as well as smaller 25 and 27 gauge needles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Xtampza microspheres were then melted at approximately 75&#xB0;C and the resulting molten material was attempted to be drawn through a needle into a syringe and then expelled through the needle. As the liquid was drawn into the syringe, it immediately solidified, making injection impossible. A comparable procedure on OxyContin OP was not performed because a substantial portion of the crushed and dissolved OxyContin OP mixture, without melting, could be passed through an 18 gauge needle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Finally, attempts were made to extract the active drug from Xtampza microspheres and OxyContin OP in injectable amounts of water. Both drugs were subjected to three manipulation techniques prior to extraction in water, consisting of crushing alone, crushing and heating them on a hot plate, and crushing and microwaving them. For Xtampza, less than 10% of the oxycodone could be extracted for injection regardless of the manipulation applied. By contrast, the amount of oxycodone extracted from OxyContin OP ranged from 17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;84%, depending on the method. Approximately 17% of oxycodone was extracted when crushed, 68% was extracted when crushed and subjected to pretreatment on a heating plate and 84% was extracted when crushed and subjected to heating in a microwave.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/18/0001558370-16-004252_COLL20151231X10K007.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.740278IN; HEIGHT: 2.454167IN" ALT="GRAPHIC">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Route Specific&nbsp;&#x2014; Smoking
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Studies have shown that less than 5% of OxyContin OP abuse is by smoking. We conducted a study comparing the ability to vaporize Xtampza, OxyContin OP, and a marketed immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release form of oxycodone. The average amount of oxycodone recovered from vapor after 3 minutes, as a percentage of the total available in the smoked capsule or pill, was approximately 17% for Xtampza, 23% for OxyContin OP and 30% for the marketed immediate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release oxycodone suggesting that Xtampza is unlikely to be abused by smoking more often than existing oxycodone products. In addition, when Xtampza is heated in order to vaporize the oxycodone, inactive excipients are also vaporized, which may be unpleasant to an abuser.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Category&nbsp;2: Oral PK Clinical Trials
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To support oral abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent product labeling for Xtampza we performed five separate PK clinical trials, three by the oral route of administration and two by the nasal route. The oral clinical trials were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_8"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:22.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">

	Key&nbsp;Objective
</FONT>

</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:42.84%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 24.5PT;TEXT-INDENT: -24.5PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Oral Crushed/Chewed PK Clinical Trial
</FONT>
<BR />
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.08%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	n&nbsp;= 44

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.06%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:22.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
