<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	common stock, regardless of our actual operating performance. The realization of any of the above risks or any of a broad range of other risks stated above could have a material adverse effect on the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As we operate in the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry, we are especially vulnerable to these factors to the extent that they affect our industry or our products. In the past, securities class action litigation has often been initiated against companies following periods of volatility in their stock price. This type of litigation could result in substantial costs and divert our management&#x2019;s attention and resources, and could also require us to make substantial payments to satisfy judgments or to settle litigation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Sales of a substantial number of shares of our common stock in the public market could cause our stock price to fall.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Sales of a substantial number of shares of our common stock in the public market could occur at any time. These sales, or the perception in the market that the holders of a large number of shares intend to sell shares, could reduce the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of March 4, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we ha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	23,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	507,347
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	outstanding, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	approximately 10.1&nbsp;million shares are currently restricted as a result of securities laws or lock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;up agreements entered into in connection with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our follow-on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	offering
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in January 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The lock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;up agreements pertaining to th
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e follow-on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	offering will expire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at the close of trading on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	April 6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;following which approximately 10.1&nbsp;million shares of common stock will be eligible for sale in the public market, all of which shares are held by current directors, executive officers, shareholders and other affiliates and may be subject to Rule&nbsp;144 under the Securities Act
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of 1933, as amended, or the Securities Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Moreover, holders of an aggregate of approximately 12.8&nbsp;million shares of our common stock have rights, subject to certain conditions, to require us to file registration statements covering their shares or to include their shares in registration statements that we may file for ourselves or other shareholders. Once we register these shares, they can be freely sold in the public market, subject to volume limitations applicable to affiliates and the lock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;up arrangements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actual or potential sales of our common stock by our directors or employees, including our executive officers, pursuant to pre
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;arranged stock trading plans could cause our stock price to fall or prevent it from increasing for numerous reasons, and actual or potential sales by such persons could be viewed negatively by investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In accordance with the guidelines specified under Rule&nbsp;10b5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;1 of the Exchange Act and our policies regarding stock transactions, our directors and employees, including our executive officers, could adopt stock trading plans pursuant to which they may sell shares of our common stock from time to time in the future. Generally, sales under such plans by our executive officers and directors require public filings. Actual or potential sales of our common stock by such persons could cause our common stock to fall or prevent it from increasing for numerous reasons. For example, a substantial number of shares of our common stock becoming available (or being perceived to become available) for sale in the public market could cause the market price of our common stock to fall or prevent it from increasing. Also, actual or potential sales by such persons could be viewed negatively by investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Future issuances of our common stock or rights to purchase common stock, including pursuant to our equity incentive plans, could result in additional dilution of the percentage ownership of our shareholders and could cause our stock price to fall.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect that significant additional capital will be needed in the future to continue our planned operations. To raise capital, we may sell substantial amounts of common stock or securities convertible into or exchangeable for common stock. These future issuances of common stock or common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;related securities, together with the exercise of outstanding options and any additional shares issued in connection with acquisitions, if any, may result in material dilution to our investors. Such sales may also result in material dilution to our existing shareholders, and new investors could gain rights, preferences and privileges senior to those of holders of our common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our principal shareholders and management own a majority of our stock and have the ability to exert significant control over matters subject to shareholder approval.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our executive officers, directors, holders of 5% or more of our capital stock and their respective affiliates beneficially owned a majority of our voting stock, including shares subject to outstanding options and warrants
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As a result, if these shareholders were to choose to act together, they would be able to significantly influence the outcome of all matters requiring shareholder approval, including the election of directors, amendments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our organizational documents, or approval of any merger, sale of assets or other major corporate transaction. This may prevent or discourage unsolicited acquisition proposals or offers for our common stock that you may feel are in your best interest. The interests of this group of shareholders may not always coincide with your interests or the interests of other shareholders and they may act in a manner that advances their best interests and not necessarily those of other shareholders, including seeking a premium value for their common stock, and might affect the prevailing market price for our common stock. Such concentration of ownership control may:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, persons associated with Longitude Capital Partners,&nbsp;LLC, Skyline Venture Partners V,&nbsp;L.P., Frazier Healthcare VI,&nbsp;L.P., and TPG Biotechnology Partners IV,&nbsp;L.P. currently serve on our board of directors. The interests of Longitude Capital Partners,&nbsp;LLC, Skyline Venture Partners V,&nbsp;L.P., Frazier Healthcare VI,&nbsp;L.P., and TPG Biotechnology Partners IV,&nbsp;L.P. may not always coincide with the interests of the other shareholders, and the concentration of control in Longitude Capital Partners,&nbsp;LLC, Skyline Venture Partners V,&nbsp;L.P., Frazier Healthcare VI,&nbsp;L.P., and TPG Biotechnology Partners IV,&nbsp;L.P. limits other shareholders&#x2019; ability to influence corporate matters. We may also take actions that our other shareholders do not view as beneficial, which may adversely affect our results of operations and financial condition and cause a decline in our stock price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We are subject to anti
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8209;takeover provisions in our amended and restated articles of incorporation and amended and restated bylaws and under Virginia law that could delay or prevent an acquisition of our company, even if the acquisition would be beneficial to our shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Certain provisions of Virginia law, the state in which we are incorporated, and our amended and restated articles of incorporation and amended and restated bylaws could hamper a third party&#x2019;s acquisition of us, or discourage a third party from attempting to acquire control of us. These provisions include:
</FONT>
</P>

	a provision allowing our board of directors to set the terms of and issue preferred stock with rights senior to those of the common stock without any vote or action by the holders of our common stock. 	the requirement that the authorized number of our directors be changed only by resolution of our board of directors;

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>

	a provision that our board of directors shall fill any vacancies on our board of directors, including vacancies resulting from a board of directors resolution to increase the number of directors;
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the lack of cumulative voting in the election of directors; and
</FONT>
</P>

</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	the prohibition on shareholders acting by less
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;unanimous written consent.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These provisions also could limit the price that certain investors might be willing to pay in the future for shares of our common stock. In addition, these provisions make it more difficult for our shareholders, should they choose to do so, to remove our board of directors or management or elect new directors to our board of directors. See &#x201C;Description of Capital Stock.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We may fail to qualify for continued listing on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Global Select Market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	which could make it more difficult for investors to sell their shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our common stock is listed on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	NASDAQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Global Select Market (&#x201C;NASDAQ&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. As a NASDAQ listed company, we are required to satisfy the continued listing requirements of NASDAQ for inclusion in the Global Select Market to maintain such listing, including, among other things, the maintenance of a minimum closing bid price of $1.00 per share and shareholders&#x2019; equity of at least $10.0&nbsp;million. There can be no assurance that we will be able to maintain compliance with the continued listing requirements or that our common stock will not be delisted from NASDAQ in the future. If our common stock is delisted by NASDAQ, we could face significant material adverse consequences, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">

	a limited amount of news and analyst coverage for our company; and
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:36PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 17.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:1PT;WIDTH:1PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	a decreased ability to issue additional securities or obtain additional financing in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	If securities or industry analysts do not publish research or publish inaccurate or unfavorable research about our business, our stock price and trading volume could decline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The trading market for our common stock depends in part on the research and reports that securities or industry analysts publish about us or our business. If one or more of the analysts who cover us downgrade our stock or publish inaccurate or unfavorable research about our business, our stock price would likely decline. If one or more of these analysts cease coverage of our company or fail to publish reports on us regularly, demand for our stock could decrease, which might cause our stock price and trading volume to decline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We are an &#x201C;emerging growth company&#x201D; and we intend to take advantage of reduced disclosure and governance requirements applicable to emerging growth companies, which could result in our common stock being less attractive to investors and we cannot be certain if the reduced reporting requirements applicable to emerging growth companies will make our shares of common stock less attractive to investors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are an &#x201C;emerging growth company,&#x201D; as defined in the JOBS Act, and may remain an emerging growth company for up to five years. For so long as we remain an emerging growth company, we are permitted and intend to rely on certain exemptions from various reporting requirements applicable to other public companies, but not to emerging growth companies, including, but not limited to, an exemption from the auditor attestation requirement of Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Oxley Act, reduced disclosure about executive compensation arrangements pursuant to the rules applicable to smaller reporting companies and no requirement to seek non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;binding advisory votes on executive compensation or golden parachute arrangements. We will remain an emerging growth company until the earliest of (i)&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2020, (ii)&nbsp;the first fiscal year after our annual gross revenue are $1.0&nbsp;billion or more, (iii)&nbsp;the date on which we have, during the previous three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year period, issued more than $1.0&nbsp;billion in non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;convertible debt securities or (iv)&nbsp;the end of any fiscal year in which the market value of our common stock held by non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;affiliates exceeded $700&nbsp;million as of the end of the second quarter of that fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	91
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, Section&nbsp;107 of the JOBS Act also provides that an emerging growth company can take advantage of the extended transition period provided in Section&nbsp;7(a)(2)(B) of the Securities Act for complying with new or revised accounting standards. An emerging growth company can therefore delay the adoption of certain accounting standards until those standards would otherwise apply to private companies. However, we are choosing to &#x201C;opt out&#x201D; of such extended transition period and, as a result, we will comply with new or revised accounting standards on the relevant dates on which adoption of such standards is required for non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;emerging growth companies. Section&nbsp;107 of the JOBS Act provides that our decision to opt out of the extended transition period for complying with new or revised accounting standards is irrevocable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We cannot predict if investors will find our common stock less attractive as a result of our taking advantage of these exemptions. If some investors find our common stock less attractive as a result of our choices, there may be a less active trading market for our common stock and our stock price may be more volatile.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	If investors find our common stock less attractive as a result of our reduced reporting requirements, there may be a less active trading market for our common stock and our stock price may be more volatile. We may also be unable to raise additional capital as and when we need it.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	If we fail to maintain an effective system of internal control over financial reporting, we may not be able to accurately report our financial condition, results of operations or cash flows, which may adversely affect investor confidence in us and, as a result, the value of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Sarbanes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Oxley Act requires, among other things, that we maintain effective internal control over financial reporting. Commencing with our annual report on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;K for the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2016, we will be required, under Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Oxley Act, to furnish a report by management on, among other things, the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting. This assessment will need to include disclosure of any material weaknesses identified by our management in our internal control over financial reporting. A material weakness is a control deficiency, or combination of control deficiencies, in internal control over financial reporting that results in more than a reasonable possibility that a material misstatement of annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis. Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Oxley Act also generally requires an attestation from our independent registered public accounting firm on the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting. However, for as long as we remain an emerging growth company as defined in the JOBS Act, we intend to take advantage of certain exemptions from various reporting requirements that are applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies including, but not limited to, not being required to comply with the independent registered public accounting firm attestation requirement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our compliance with Section&nbsp;404 will require that we incur substantial accounting expense and expend significant management efforts. We currently do not have an internal audit group, and we will need to hire additional accounting and financial staff with appropriate public company experience and technical accounting knowledge, and compile the system and process documentation necessary to perform the evaluation needed to comply with Section&nbsp;404. We may not be able to complete our evaluation, testing and any required remediation in a timely fashion, which could potentially subject us to sanctions or investigations by the SEC or other regulatory authorities. During the evaluation and testing process, if we identify one or more material weaknesses in our internal control over financial reporting, we will be unable to assert that our internal control over financial reporting is effective. We cannot assure you that there will not be material weaknesses or significant deficiencies in our internal control over financial reporting in the future. Any failure to maintain internal control over financial reporting could severely inhibit our ability to accurately report our financial condition, results of operations or cash flows. If we are unable to conclude that our internal control over financial reporting is effective, or if our independent registered public accounting firm determines we have a material weakness or significant deficiency in our internal control over financial reporting once that firm begin its reviews, we could lose investor confidence in the accuracy and completeness of our financial reports, the market price of our common stock could decline, and we could be subject to sanctions or investigations by NASDAQ, the SEC or other regulatory authorities. Failure to remedy any material weakness in our internal control over financial reporting, or to implement or maintain other effective control systems required of public companies, could also restrict our future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	access to the capital markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	92
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Our disclosure controls and procedures may not prevent or detect all errors or acts of fraud.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are subject to the periodic reporting requirements of the Exchange Act. Our disclosure controls and procedures are designed to reasonably assure that information required to be disclosed by us in reports we file or submit under the Exchange Act is accumulated and communicated to management, recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the rules and forms of the SEC. We believe that any disclosure controls and procedures, no matter how well conceived and operated, can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that the objectives of the control system are met.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These inherent limitations reflect the reality that judgments can be faulty, and that breakdowns can occur because of simple error or mistake. Additionally, controls can be circumvented by the individual acts of some persons, by collusion of two or more people or by an unauthorized override of the controls. Accordingly, because of the inherent limitations in our control system, misstatements due to error or fraud may occur and not be detected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	The exercise of options and warrants and other issuances of shares of common stock or securities convertible into or exercisable for shares of common stock will dilute your ownership interests and may adversely affect the future market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Sales of our common stock in the public market, either by us or by our current shareholders, or the perception that these sales could occur, could cause a decline in the market price of our securities. All of the shares of our common stock held by those of our current shareholders who have not entered into lock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;up agreements may be immediately eligible for resale in the open market either in compliance with an exemption under Rule&nbsp;144 promulgated under the Securities Act, or pursuant to an effective resale registration statement that we have previously filed with the SEC. Such sales, along with any other market transactions, could adversely affect the market price of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2015, there were (a)&nbsp;outstanding options to purchase an aggregate of 1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	452,251
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of our common stock at a weighted average exercise price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	10.37
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per share, of which options to purchase 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5,891
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of our common stock were then exercisable, and (b)&nbsp;2,445 shares of common stock issuable upon the exercise of warrants to purchase common stock at a weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average exercise price of $12.27 per share. The exercise of options and warrants at prices below the market price of our common stock could adversely affect the price of shares of our common stock. Additional dilution may result from the issuance of shares of our common stock in connection with collaborations or manufacturing arrangements or in connection with other financing efforts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Any issuance of our common stock that is not made solely to then
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;existing shareholders proportionate to their interests, such as in the case of a stock dividend or stock split, will result in dilution to each shareholder by reducing his, her or its percentage ownership of the total outstanding shares. Moreover, if we issue options or warrants to purchase our common stock in the future and those options or warrants are exercised you may experience further dilution. Holders of shares of our common stock have no preemptive rights that entitle them to purchase their pro rata share of any offering of shares of any class or series.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We have broad discretion in the use of our cash and ca
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	sh equivalents,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	and, despite our efforts, we may use them in a manner that does not increase the value of your investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have broad discretion in the use of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our cash and cash equivalents,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and investors must rely on the judgment of our management regarding the use of our cash and cash equivalents. Our management may not use cash and cash equivalents in ways that ultimately increase the value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our common stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Our failure to use our cash and cash equivalents effectively could result in financial losses that could have a material adverse effect on our business, cause the price of our common stock to decline and delay the development of our product candidates. Pending their use, we may invest our cash and cash equivalents in short
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term or long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term, investment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;grade, interest
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;bearing securities. These investments may not yield favorable returns. If we do not invest or apply our cash and cash equivalents in ways that enhance shareholder value, we may fail to achieve expected financial results, which could cause the price of our common stock to decline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Because we do not anticipate paying any cash dividends on our capital stock in the foreseeable future, capital appreciation, if any, will be your sole source of gain.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	common
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	stock. We currently intend to retain all of our future
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

	earnings, if any, to finance the growth and development of our business and do not anticipate declaring or paying any cash dividends for the foreseeable future. In addition, the terms of any future debt agreements may preclude us from paying dividends. As a result, capital appreciation, if any, of our capital stock will be your sole source of gain for the foreseeable future.

</FONT>
<A NAME="COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM2PROPERTIES_314266">
</A>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM_1_3_5">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our corporate headquarters are located in Canton, Massachusetts, where we lease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	19,335
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	square feet of office space (including chemistry and pilot/formulation laboratories) under a lease agreement that was amended in March 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he lease term terminates on the date that is five years following August 2015, which is the date that the landlord delivered the expansion space with certain improvements substantially completed. The lease term may be extended for an additional five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year term at our election.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We believe that our existing facility is adequate for our current and expected future needs. We may seek to negotiate new leases or evaluate additional or alternate space for our operations. We believe that appropriate alternative space is readily available on commercially reasonable terms.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Item&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Legal
</FONT>
<A NAME="COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM3LEGAL_626288">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Proceedings
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM_1_3_6">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	From time to time we face legal claims or actions in the normal course of business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We filed the NDA for Xtampza as a 505(b)(2) application, which allows us to reference data from an approved drug listed in the FDA&#x2019;s Approved Drug Products with Therapeutic Equivalence Evaluations (commonly known as the Orange Book), in this case OxyContin OP. The 505(b)(2) process requires that we certify to the FDA and notify Purdue, as the holder of the NDA and any other Orange Book
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;listed patent owners, that we do not infringe any of the patents listed for OxyContin OP in the Orange Book, or that the patents are invalid. We made such certification and provided such notice on February&nbsp;11, 2015 and such certification documented why Xtampza does not infringe any of the 11 Orange Book listed patents for OxyContin OP, five of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	have been adjudged invalid in litigation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Under the Hatch
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Waxman Act of 1984, Purdue had the option to sue us for infringement and receive a stay of up to 30&nbsp;months before the FDA can issue a final regulatory approval for Xtampza, unless the stay is earlier terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Purdue exercised its option and elected to sue us for infringement in the District of Delaware on March&nbsp;24, 2015 asserting infringement of three of Purdue&#x2019;s Orange Book
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;listed patents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Purdue filed another case in Massachusetts asserting the same four patents as in the Delaware case. On October&nbsp;7, 2015, the Delaware case was transferred to Massachusetts and on November&nbsp;4, 2015, the two cases pending in Massachusetts were consolidated. On November&nbsp;9, 2015, we filed a motion for partial judgment on the pleadings in relation to three of the four patents asserted against us, which had been previously invalidated by the court in the Southern District of New York in Purdue&#x2019;s suit against Teva. On the same date, we moved for entry of final judgment and to expedite hearing on our motions.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On February 1, 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	affirmed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the New York judgment of invalidity
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On February 9, 2016, the District Court of Massachusetts ordered judgment in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	favor on the three Orange Book listed patents that were the basis of the 30-month stay, Patent Nos. 7,674,799, 7,674,800, and 7,683,072 and dismissed the claims asserting infringement of those patents with prejudice. Purdue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	has reserved its right to appeal the judgment and dismissal and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	continues to assert infringement of two patents against
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	us
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, neither of which is associated with any stay of FDA approval.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	moved for judgment of invalidity of one of those patents based on collateral estoppel and that motion remains pending.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

</EFX_PART_I>
<EFX_PART_II>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_II"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	PART I
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">

</FONT>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_11"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8.8PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Our common stock is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol &#x201C;COLL&#x201D; since May 7, 2015. Prior to May 7, 2015, there was no public trading market for our common stock. The following table sets forth, for the periods indicated, the high and low sales prices for our common stock as reported on NASDAQ:
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Holders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8.8PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	As of February&nbsp;29, 2016, there were 60 holders of record of our common stock. The number of holders of record does not include beneficial owners whose shares are held by nominees in street name.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Dividends
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8.8PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our common stock, and we do not expect to pay any cash dividends on our common stock in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 11PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Stock Performance Graph
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:107.92%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The following graph shows a comparison from May 7, 2015, the date on which our common stock first began trading on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, of the total cumulative shareholder return on an assumed investment of $100.00 in cash in our common stock as compared to the same investment in the NASDAQ Composite Index and the NASDAQ Biotechnology Index, all through December 31, 2015. Such returns are based on historical results and are not intended to suggest future performance. Data for the NASDAQ Composite Index and NASDAQ Biotechnology Index assume reinvestment of dividends, however no dividends have been declared on our common stock to date.
</FONT>
</P>

	promulgated under the Securities Act. We did not sell any other equity securities during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015 in transactions that were not registered under the Securities Act, other than as previously disclosed in our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q for the periods ended March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2015.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Use of Proceeds
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our IPO was effected through a Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-1 (File No.&nbsp;333-203208) that was declared effective by the SEC on May&nbsp;6, 2015, which registered an aggregate of 6,670,000 shares of our common stock.&nbsp;On May&nbsp;12, 2015, 6,670,000 shares of common stock were sold on our behalf at an IPO price of $12.00 per share, including 870,000 shares of common stock upon the exercise by the underwriters of their option to purchase additional shares at the public offering price, for aggregate gross proceeds of $74.4 million. As of the date of filing this report, the offering has terminated, and all of the securities registered pursuant to the offering have been sold prior to termination. Jefferies LLC and Piper Jaffray&nbsp;&amp; Co. acted as joint book-running managers. Wells Fargo Securities, LLC acted as lead manager and Needham&nbsp;&amp; Company, LLC acted as co-manager in the offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The net proceeds of the offering to us, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions of $5.6 million and offering expenses of $2.4 million, were approximately $72.0 million.&nbsp;On May&nbsp;12, 2015, the closing date of the offering, we received the proceeds from the offering, $21.1 million of which have been utilized for the development of our commercial infrastructure, research and development of our other product candidates and general corporate purposes, including working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The foregoing expenses are a reasonable estimate of the expenses incurred by us in the offering and do not represent the exact amount of expenses incurred. All of the foregoing expenses were direct or indirect payments to persons other than (i)&nbsp;our directors, officers or any of their associates; (ii)&nbsp;persons owning 10% or more of our common stock; or (iii)&nbsp;our affiliates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 9PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	There has been no material change in the use of proceeds from the IPO as described in the final prospectus filed with the SEC on May 7, 2015 under &#x201C;Use of Proceeds.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

	Form&nbsp;10-K

	for an explanation of the method used to calculate earnings (loss) per common share attributable to common shareholders, including the method used to calculate the number of shares used in the computation of the per share amount.

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:06.86%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
<DIV STYLE="FLOAT:LEFT">
</DIV>
	85,072
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.14%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.46%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

	(89,348)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.14%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	anagement&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<A NAME="COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM7MANAGEMENTS_59135">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 13.2PT;COLOR:#000000;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	You should read the following discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations together with our consolidated financial statements and related notes appearing elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA MATH;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	K. The following discussion contains forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA MATH;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties. Our actual results and the timing of certain events could differ materially from those anticipated in these forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA MATH;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	looking statements as a result of certain factors, including those discussed below and as set forth under &#x201C;Risk Factors.&#x201D; Please also refer to the section under heading &#x201C;Forward
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:CAMBRIA MATH;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Looking Statements.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are a specialty pharmaceutical company developing and planning to commercialize next
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;generation abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent products that incorporate our patented DETERx
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	platform technology for the treatment of chronic pain and other diseases. Our lead product candidate, Xtampza, is an abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent, extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release, oral formulation of oxycodone, a widely prescribed opioid medication. On November&nbsp;6, 2015, the FDA granted tentative approval to the NDA for Xtampza for the management of pain severe enough to require daily, around
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;clock, long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;term opioid treatment and for which alternative treatment options are inadequate. The FDA granted tentative approval because Xtampza met the required quality, safety and efficacy standards for approval but
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	subject
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, at that time,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to an automatic stay of up to 30&nbsp;months as a result of patent litigation filed by Purdue in March 2015. The FDA may grant final regulatory approval upon the earliest to occur of expiration of the automatic stay, the court invalidating Purdue&#x2019;s patents or issuing an opinion of non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;infringement,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	expiration of Purdue&#x2019;s listed patents.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In February 2016, the District Court of Massachusetts entered a judgment in our favor related to Purdue&#x2019;s three Orange Book-listed patents that were the cause of the 30 month stay.&nbsp;&nbsp;We submitted our Request for Final Approval of the Xtampza NDA to the FDA on February 26, 2016. The FDA has set a PDUFA goal date of April 26, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In connection with the FDA&#x2019;s tentative approval of our NDA for Xtampza, the FDA tentatively approved a product label, product packaging, post
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;marketing commitments and a REMS program, subject to change should new information become available prior to the time that the FDA considers the Xtampza NDA for final regulatory approval. The tentatively approved Xtampza label, in contrast to the product labels for all currently approved extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioids, does not include a black box warning and related precautions stating that crushing, chewing or dissolving can cause rapid release and absorption of a potentially fatal dose of the active ingredient. The absence of these warnings is supported by data that is described in the tentatively approved product label to support the claim that when Xtampza is crushed or chewed, the drug release profile is bioequivalent to taking Xtampza intact, as directed. Furthermore, the tentatively approved product label contains differentiated abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent claims for Xtampza and also states that Xtampza can be taken by sprinkling the capsule contents on soft foods or into a cup, and then directly into the mouth, or through a gastrostomy or nasogastric feeding tube.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Xtampza has the same active ingredient as OxyContin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:5PT;TOP:-4PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;LINE-HEIGHT:100%">
	&#xAE;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	OP, which is the largest selling abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent, extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release opioid in the United States by dollars, with $2.5&nbsp;billion in U.S. sales in 2014. We conducted a comprehensive preclinical and clinical program for Xtampza consistent with FDA guidance on abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrence. These studies and clinical trials demonstrated that chewing, crushing and/or dissolving Xtampza, and then taking it orally or smoking, snorting or injecting it did not meaningfully change its drug release profile or safety characteristics. By contrast, clinical trials performed by us and others&nbsp;&#x2014; including a head
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;head clinical trial comparing Xtampza with OxyContin OP&nbsp;&#x2014; have shown that drug abusers can achieve rapid release and absorption of the active ingredient by manipulating OxyContin OP using common household tools and methods commonly available on the Internet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, our preclinical studies and clinical trials have shown that the contents of the Xtampza capsule can be removed from the capsule and sprinkled on food
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	into a cup, and then
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	directly into the mouth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or administered through feeding tubes, without compromising their drug release profile, safety or abuse
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;deterrent characteristics. By contrast, OxyContin OP, which is formulated in hard tablets, has a black box warning product label stating that crushing, dissolving, or chewing can cause rapid release and absorption of a potentially fatal dose of the active ingredient. We believe that Xtampza, if it ultimately receives final regulatory approval, can address the pain management needs of the approximately 11&nbsp;million patients in the United States who suffer from chronic pain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	difficulty swallowing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Since 2010, when we divested our former subsidiary, Onset Therapeutics,&nbsp;LLC, to PreCision Dermatology,&nbsp;Inc., we have devoted substantially all of our resources to the development of our patented DETERx platform technology, the preclinical and clinical advancement of our product candidates, and the creation and protection of related intellectual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	99
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#COLL-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	property. Since 2011, we have not generated any revenue from product sales as we currently have no approved products, and we continue to incur significant research, development
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, commercialization
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and other expenses related to our ongoing operations. Prior to our IPO, in May 2015, we funded our operations primarily through the private placement of preferred stock, convertible notes and commercial bank debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Outlook
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have never been profitable and have incurred net losses in each year since inception. We incurred net losses of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	27.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	17.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and $16.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2015, we had an accumulated deficit of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	129.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million. Substantially all of our net losses resulted from costs incurred in connection with our research and development programs and from general and administrative costs associated with our operations. We expect to continue to incur net losses in the foreseeable future as we seek final regulatory approval for, and, if approved, begin to commercialize Xtampza. Our net losses may fluctuate significantly from quarter to quarter and year to year. We expect our expenses will increase substantially in connection with our ongoing activities as we:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	conduct clinical trials of our product candidates;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">

<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	hire additional general and administrative personnel to operate as a public company.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	If we obtain final regulatory approval for Xtampza, we expect to incur significant commercialization expenses related to marketing, manufacturing, distribution, product sales and reimbursement functions. Initially we plan to detail Xtampza to approximately 11,000 physicians who write approximately 55% of the branded extended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;release oral opioid prescriptions in the United States with a sales team of approximately 120 sales representatives. In addition, we plan to deploy a separate, focused sales team of approximately 25 specialty sales representatives to detail Xtampza to nursing homes, hospices and other institutions treating large populations of the elderly and other patients who need chronic pain relief and have difficulty swallowing. Accordingly, we will seek to fund our operations through public or private equity or debt financings or other sources. However, we may be unable to raise additional funds or enter into such other arrangements when needed on favorable terms or at all. Our failure to raise capital or enter into such other arrangements when needed would have a negative impact on our financial condition and ability to develop our product candidates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Financial Operations Overview
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Since 2011, we have not generated any revenue. In the future, we may generate revenue from product sales, marketing and distribution arrangements and other collaborations, strategic alliances and licensing arrangements, or a combination of these sources. To the extent any of our product candidates are successfully commercialized, we expect that any revenue we generate will fluctuate from quarter to quarter as a result of the amount and timing of payments that we receive upon the sale of our products,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the timing and amount of license fees, milestone and other payments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Research and Development Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Research and development expenses consist of development costs associated with our DETERx platform technology and product candidates programs. These costs are expensed as incurred and include:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">

<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:SYMBOL;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	&#xB7;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	compensation and employee
</FONT>

	&#8209;based compensation;
